intro: Ruizterania trichanthera, commonly known as the creeping broom. It is a flowering plant species native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. Ruizterania trichanthera typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds.
